title: Understanding Gibbs Free Energy
text: The Gibbs Free Energy change, denoted as ∆G°, determines if a reaction is spontaneous at a given temperature. If ∆G° is negative, the reaction is spontaneous.

title: Check ∆G° Value
text: Since $$∆G\degree=\frac{-33.3kJ}{mol}$$ is negative, what does this imply about the reaction's spontaneity?
